summary: Artwork gallery app "Z'art" where any user can upload artworks with title/description/GBP price, view them in a gallery, tap to view full display, and automatically resize oversized images on upload. Upload page remains accessible to all authenticated users; remove the Gallery homescreen upload shortcut.
architectural_notes: Store artwork metadata: title, description, price (GBP) alongside image asset.
Implement automatic image resizing/compression during upload to handle oversized images.
Remove admin-only gating for upload UI and backend create endpoints; upload route/shortcut should be visible and accessible to all authenticated users.
Remove the Gallery homescreen Upload shortcut card/navigation shortcut; rely on Upload page access via route/header navigation (authenticated users only).
known_issues: Deployment/build process encountered an error; user requested a retry.

existing_features.title: Set the application name to "Z'art" and reflect it consistently in the UI (header/title) and any app metadata used by the frontend.

Implement frontend gallery browsing: display artworks in a responsive grid with thumbnail/preview, title, and GBP price. When a user taps/clicks an artwork card, open a full artwork view that shows the image fully along with title, description, and formatted GBP price.

Implement an admin-only upload workflow in the frontend: an upload form for title, description, GBP price input, and image file selection; show this UI only when the authenticated user is the admin (as determined by the backend).

Automatically resize oversized images on the client before upload: when an admin selects an image larger than a defined maximum dimension and/or file size, resize it (preserving aspect ratio) and compress it to a reasonable JPEG/WEBP quality before sending to the backend.

Apply a cohesive visual theme suitable for an artwork gallery (non-blue/non-purple primary palette), including typography, spacing, and card/detail view styling, and use it consistently across gallery, detail view, and admin upload UI.
Generate required static brand images and render them in the UI from frontend static assets (do not serve generated images through the backend).
Split the admin artwork upload UI into a dedicated upload page/view, so the gallery view no longer contains the upload form.
Add in-app navigation to access the separate Upload page and back to Gallery, showing the Upload navigation entry only to authenticated admins; prevent non-admin users from accessing the Upload page.
Add an admin-only shortcut on the homescreen (Gallery view) that navigates directly to the Upload page.
Add a clear visual cue to the admin-only Upload shortcut card on the Gallery view so the shortcut is visually highlighted compared to surrounding content.

Ensure the admin-only Upload shortcut card is visible on the Gallery (homescreen) view whenever the authenticated user is an admin, and make the UI resilient to admin-status loading/refresh so the shortcut reliably appears after login.

Ensure the admin-only Upload shortcut card on the Gallery view renders reliably for authenticated admins, including during the period when admin status is still being determined (e.g., actor/identity/admin query not yet ready), so the shortcut does not fail to appear after login or page refresh.

Increase the visual prominence of the admin Upload shortcut card on the Gallery view so it is clearly noticeable compared to surrounding content (stronger contrast, clearer call-to-action, and improved layout for small screens), while keeping user-facing copy in English.
Add an admin-only artwork uploading section directly on the homescreen (Gallery view) that lets authenticated admins upload a new artwork without navigating to the separate Upload page.

Keep the dedicated Upload page route and header navigation behavior unchanged, and ensure the new homescreen upload section does not break or replace the existing admin-only Upload shortcut card and Upload page access controls.

Update frontend route guarding for the Upload page so that any authenticated user can access the upload route; unauthenticated users attempting to access the upload route must be blocked with an appropriate message and a navigation option back to the Gallery.
Update header navigation so the Upload navigation entry is visible to all authenticated users (not admin-only).

Update the Gallery homescreen upload shortcut and inline upload section so they are available to all authenticated users (not admin-only), and remove/adjust any user-facing copy that claims uploads are admin-only.

Remove the GalleryView inline upload section corresponding to XPath /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/main[1]/section[1]/div[2]/div[1] (the <div className="mb-12"> wrapper that renders <AdminUploadForm />) so the upload form no longer appears on the Gallery page.

Remove the header navigation shortcut button at XPath /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/header[1]/div[1]/div[2]/nav[1]/button[2] (the authenticated-only "Upload" button) so it no longer renders in the app header navigation.

Remove the header navigation button at XPath /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/header[1]/div[1]/div[2]/nav[1]/button[2] so it no longer renders in the app header navigation (this is the authenticated-only "Upload" button in the header nav).

new_feature_requests.summary: Artwork uploads include title, description, and price in GBP
Gallery view: display uploaded artworks and open full display when tapped
Automatically resize oversized images on upload

Create backend CRUD endpoints for artworks with the following fields: id, title, description, price in GBP (stored as integer minor units/pence), image content, image content type, created timestamp, and owner/uploader principal. Restrict creation (upload) to admin callers.
Separate the admin artwork uploading page from the public gallery view (dedicated upload route/page rather than combined UI)
Add an artwork uploading section on the homescreen (Gallery view) for admins
Allow all authenticated users (not just admin) to upload new artworks (remove admin-only gating in frontend and backend).
Update backend authorization so that any authenticated user (permission #user) can create/upload new artworks, rather than restricting uploads to admins only.
